image.altText: Downtown Alice

props.synopsis: NT Police are investigating a fatal crash that killed a male pedestrian in Alice Springs on Sunday morning as well as a hit-and-run incident in Katherine on Saturday.

title.children: Pedestrian dies after being struck by car in Alice Springs overnight

image.altText: Sue La Velle

props.synopsis: Photos and a box of ashes are all Sue La Velle has after her son was found dead in a Melbourne home in June. She's sharing her story for the first time in the hope it will prevent others from meeting the same fate.Â

title.children: A synthetic opioid more potent than fentanyl is spreading across Australia with fatal consequences

image.altText: A chair lift at the bottom of a set of household stairs.

props.synopsis: Older Australians being cared for at home will be able to apply for a new $25,000 palliative support payment when they have three months of life left under the government's aged care overhaul.

title.children: A new $25,000 support payment seeks to make it easier for people to die at home

image.altText: A graphic depicting an American flag that has been torn in half, with a shadow hanging over it.

props.synopsis: Of all the schisms that cleave contemporary America, few are more stark than the divide between those who consider themselves to be victims of US history and those who fear they will be casualties of its future.

title.children: America is on the verge of something fateful, but it cannot escape history

image.altText: An aboriginal man looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Brian never had cake on his birthday as a child, just "hidings" every other day. He is one of many Indigenous people providing testimony to Queensland's Truth-Telling and Healing Inquiry.

title.children: 'What's a mother?': The story of the boy who never had a birthday cake

image.altText: A woman in tears sits next to a young girl.

props.synopsis: A series of mass evictions has uprooted entire communities in the Pacific Island nation as people move to its urban fringes â and the government is looking for answers.Â

title.children: 'My heart was in pain': Vanuatu's mass evictions are leaving families in limbo

image.altText: Storm debris covers Stanwell Park beach

props.synopsis: There are growing signs Australia's most impactful climate driver, La NiÃ±a, will develop during the coming months.

title.children: Latest modelling tips fourth La NiÃ±a for Australia in five years before year's end

image.altText: AÂ Sudanese refugee stands in front of rows of people sitting on the ground in Chad.

props.synopsis: Death, displacement, famine, and the collapse of most government and public infrastructure -- that's been the experience of the ongoing civil war in Sudan.

title.children: With 10 million displaced, some call it the forgotten war. These numbers explain the conflict in Sudan

image.altText: A birds eye view of the river coming down

props.synopsis: The mesmerising transformation of parched sand giving way to the rush of fresh, flowing water has people across a vast outback region in awe as it carves a path from the bush to the sea.

title.children: After weeks of relentless rain, this once-dry riverbed begins to brim with life-giving water

image.altText: an aerial photo of a gas well.

props.synopsis:
Fracking projects in the Beetaloo Basin will face fresh scrutiny as the federal environment minister orders an assessment into the potential water impacts on gas exploration in the basin.

Â

title.children: NT fracking projects facing fresh scrutiny with potential for 'water trigger' to be pulled

image.altText: Ben Carroll talking to the government.

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered to lift its funding share for public schools, but Victoria has rejected the offer in a situation the state's education minister has described as "difficult".

title.children: Victoria rejects federal government school funding offer, creating a 'difficult' stalemate

image.altText: A woman wearing red sunglasses

props.synopsis: Clover Moore says she is set to serve a record sixth term as lord mayor after the local government elections across NSW.

title.children: City of Sydney Lord Mayor Clover Moore says council election could be her last amid sixth term prospect

image.altText: A redheaded man with a beard

props.synopsis: As Harry turns 40, he has not only transitioned from the cheeky spare into a husband and father, he has increasingly aligned himself with Diana's family over the House of Windsor.

title.children: Harry at 40: Why the prince is now firmly aligned with Diana's wealthy family of rebels

image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: "The Bruce" is being labelled a national disgrace, pock-marked with dangerous potholes and signposted with memorials to people who have died on the notorious road.

title.children: The national highway that some drivers say is more like a 'goat track' â with deadly consequences

image.altText: Flewnt and Inkabee performing on a blue coloured stage

props.synopsis: Flewnt and Inkabee were lauded for their 'mesmerising' performance on America's Got Talent. But a social media photo prompted a very different reaction in Australia.Â

title.children: The US loved this Perth father-son rap duo on America's Got Talent. Back home, they were vilified

image.altText: A woman wearing a cap holdings a long brown basket on her back while she picks green leaves.

props.synopsis: Sri Lanka's tea industry grapples with a steep wage hike, but some estate owners embrace new approaches to balance worker welfare and productivity in a bid to save the sector.Â

title.children: Sri Lanka supplies most of Australia's tea, but its industry is now at a crossroad

image.altText: A tank flying the flag of Israel drives on a street surrounded by destroyed buildings.

props.synopsis: An IDF air strike on a Gaza City house where displaced Palestinians were taking refuge has killed 11 people, Gaza's civil defence ministry said.

title.children: Israeli strike on Gaza City home kills 11 people, civil defence agency says

image.altText: Laura Loomer in focus in the foreground; Donald Trump blurred in the background.

props.synopsis: Laura Loomer joined US presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign trial this week, attending his presidential debate against Kamala Harris and joining him for a 9/11 memorial service.

title.children: Who is Laura Loomer, the far-right activist Republicans fear is influencing Donald Trump with 'garbage' tactics?

image.altText: A man with a shaved head wears the Ukraine flag around his neck while making the "peace" sign.

props.synopsis: The United Arab Emirates mediates an exchange of 206 prisoners of war between Russia and Ukraine.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners of war in eighth swap brokered by UAE

image.altText: A missile attached to a military aircraft

props.synopsis: Ukraine has long requested permission to use Britain-supplied Storm Shadows inside Russian territory, and a go-ahead appears imminent.

title.children: Why have talks on the use of Storm Shadow missiles prompted Russia to threaten war against NATO?

image.altText: Ostrich looking at camera; a close up head shot.

props.synopsis:
Animals can sleep on the wing, standing up, sitting in a tree or diving in the ocean. Many don't close their eyes, and some don't even have eyelids. Here are some of the strangest ways to snooze.

Â

title.children: Is this ostrich awake or asleep? The sleeping habits of many animals may surprise you

image.altText: damaged overhead powerlines

props.synopsis: Lengthy delays to a return of power for tens of thousands of Tasmanians during recent wild weather will be the topic of an independent review, as the state looks to learn from response shortcomings.

title.children: Tasmanians left with extended power outage to vent frustrations as independent inquiry into response announced

image.altText: A family holds a cheetah pup.

props.synopsis: The fly-in, fly-out mine worker's travel insurance had expired when the crash left him fighting for life as his family scrambled to cover expenses and get him home. And that's a cautionary tale for Australians overseas, says a medical repatriation expert.

title.children: Australian car crash victim flown to Perth for surgery after months in a Thai hospital

image.altText: A young teen with braces, a wide-brimmed hat and agriculture show ribbons on her shoulders smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Amy Ballinger hates to think of the consequences if the persecution she suffered had followed her home. As her own children start school she wants them banned from social media until they're 16.

title.children: Bullies made school hell for Amy. Now she's a mum backing a new social media age limit

image.altText: Police outside a nightclub

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries following an alleged attack at a 24-hour nightclub.

title.children: Police hunt for attackers after alleged stabbing at Melbourne's Revolver Upstairs

image.altText: A teenage boy in formal wear standing in an event hall with white chairs and cake

props.synopsis: Life saving and migration experts say the recent disappearance of a teenager who was swept from rocks has highlighted the urgent need for water safety warnings to be given to migrants even before they leave their countries of origin, in order to urgently reduce the high number of drowning tragedies involving new arrivals.

title.children: Teen's disappearance prompts call for migrants to receive water safety warnings before arriving in Australia

image.altText: An illustration of a well-dressed 18th century man with words in the background

props.synopsis: Colonial Australian John Lang lived a life of dramatic highs and lows, and he may have been the first Australian novelist. He is celebrated in India, but still largely unknown on our shores.

title.children: This novel has murky origins. It could have a momentous place in Australian history

image.altText: A man creating street art in an alleyway

props.synopsis: With its laneways a hotspot for tourists, Melbourne City Council walks a fine line of encouraging the street art scene while keeping the taggers to a minimum.

title.children: Is it art or is it a crime? These are the rules of street art in Australia's graffiti capital

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player is seen surrounded by GWS players, with a defender's arms wrapped around him.

props.synopsis: Dual Brownlow medallist Lachie Neale had his foot in a moonboot after Brisbane's stunning AFL semi-final comeback win over GWS, but he is expected to be fit to play in the prelim against Geelong.

title.children: Moonboot and a prelim: Neale backed to tackle Cats after Lions' stunning finals win

image.altText: Reuben Cotter of the Cowboys celebrates with teammates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: North Queensland have found ways to win their past four games in Sydney and the Cowboys say they won't be daunted by another journey in the knockout final against Cronulla.

title.children: Early to bed ... Cowboys' secret to Sydney winning run as they keep finals hopes alive

image.altText: A tan, black and white working dog cross and a larger light coloured Husky standing at a glass door looking inside at treats.

props.synopsis: Kyra Duffy now thinks her dogs have been stolen and she's dismayed there's no national pet database to help her.

title.children: 'Pet detective' calls for national microchipping registry to help track missing dogs

image.altText: A Black woman in street clothes instructs young dancers in ballet outfits

props.synopsis: Ballet dancer Michaela Mabinty DePrince, who was raised in an orphanage in war-torn Sierra Leone, is being remembered as "a beautiful person, a wonderful dancer".

title.children: Ballerina Michaela Mabinty DePrince, who grew up in a Sierra Leone orphanage, dies aged 29

image.altText: A composite image of a meteor hunter at a museum and performing a dance.

props.synopsis: For Robert Towers, hunting meteorites is a "wonderful hobby" â but his strike rate is impressive, and he hopes the ancient space rocks could hold undiscovered clues to the origins of the Earth and life itself.

title.children: Meteorite hunter with hundreds of finds under his belt still celebrating discoveries with a dance

image.altText: A man boxes the air in a ring, in a hazy light coming from behind the ring. The figure cuts through the haze.

props.synopsis: While tent boxing has been the focus of multiple documentaries, Kid Snow marks the first major fiction film about the sport.

title.children: Tent boxing entertained Australians for decades. Now, a new drama recreates its brutal magic
